channel.title: Plan :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Plan Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: The plan group’s scope includes: Content focused on readers wanting to understand how to plan out their IAM solutions strategically and holistically. The content includes: Available access control strategies Available authentication methods (MFA, biometrics, etc) Policies Deployment considerations including topics such as: Availability Reliability Performance etc Best practices content Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer

item.title: Best practices for implementing a passwordless solution
item.description: Best practices for implementing a passwordless solution Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Links to original docs: - Best practices for password optional: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/pwd-optional-best-practices/nodeexpress/main/ Structure type: Concept Content type: Best practice A Best Practices document presents a set of best practices to the reader. They may pertain to design, coding, or administrative tasks but do not often include actual step-by-step instructions.

item.title: Build with Okta Identity Governance
item.description: Build with Okta Identity Governance Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Why is this here?: All “Other” solutions (which are solutions other than LCM, Automation, and Authentication), 27% of the “Other” solutions customer are building are OIG based. Structure type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews. They aim to clarify specific elements of the technology, offering developers practical insights or in-depth clarification on particular points of interest.

item.title: Store your users across multiple tenants
item.description: Store your users across multiple tenants Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: Change title, move definitions and theory of tenants and multi-tenants to Learn > OIDC > Tenants. This page is purely about helping the reader to understand and choose between the different ways to implement multi-tenant apps. Hub and spoke, etc. Links to original docs: - Multi-tenant solutions: https://developer.
